com.ucsf.core.services

Class DeviceInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Service
      • com.google.android.gms.wearable.WearableListenerService
        • com.ucsf.core.services.DeviceInterface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.wearable.CapabilityApi.CapabilityListener, com.google.android.gms.wearable.ChannelApi.ChannelListener, com.google.android.gms.wearable.DataApi.DataListener, com.google.android.gms.wearable.MessageApi.MessageListener, com.google.android.gms.wearable.NodeApi.NodeListener, com.google.android.gms.wearable.NodeApi.zza
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeviceInterface, DeviceInterface

    public abstract class DeviceInterface
extends com.google.android.gms.wearable.WearableListenerService
    Service responsible of the communication between phone and watch. Allows exchange of events, requests and data. Events are sent once and may not be received. Requests are sent as long no answer is received until they time out. Data are sent once but you can detect when the transaction fails.

      • sendRequest

        protected static void sendRequest(Context context,
                                  Messages.Request request,
                                  DeviceInterface.RequestListener listener,
                                  java.io.Serializable value)
        Sends a request for the given message until an answer is received. Returns the request id. If a request for the same message is already running, cancels it first, i.e. only one request for a given message is running at the same time. The given value is identified by the key Messages.VALUE.

      • sendRequest

                                  Entry... entries)
        Sends a request for the given message until an answer is received. Returns the request id. If a request for the same message is already running, cancels it first, i.e. only one request for a given message is running at the same time.

        protected static <any> parseMessagePath(java.lang.String path)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses the given message path and return the corresponding table name and entry row id. If the path is ill-formed, throws an excpetion.

        java.lang.Exception
